content: Unbelievably awesome, as it was the first time!

I find the controls a bit janky, and trying to move can be a problem. This may just be me but it feels like when I try to use the the ingame joystick, I either go at breakneck speeds, or walk slowly to where I wanna go. Luckily you can adjust that in the settings. What you cant adjust is the audio. You CAN turn the volume off on your phone, but I generally like to listen to a podcast while playing RPG'S. I guess the best changes would be fixed joystick placement, and ability to mute audio
Don't like the controls or the graphics filter

If you developers of chrono trigger would add a volume option to control music and sound effects sounds would be make me and others deeply thankful . And if this volume option is added to this game I'll turn my 4 star rating to a 5 star rating.

Works well for the most part, sometimes crashes but the game auto saves every time a room is entered so not a big deal usually. Has new game plus which is fantastic. Selecting a specific enemy is some times annoying as if you don't touch the precise location of the enemy sprite it'll just attack the default selected enemy. Wish there was an option to adjust in-game audio.
A timeless classic that never gets old
Incredible port, can never say no to Chrono Trigger
The best RPG in the world
PLEASE MAKE CHRONO CROSS FOR PHONES IM GETTING OLD AND BEEN WAITING SO MANY YEARS!!!
I love this game they should make a remake on ps 5 it would be number 1
One of the best RPGs ever.
wasted 10 bucks, my ps4 controller glitches every 5 minutes and my character just runs into the corner and won't move.
Chronorific!!!
Its a 5 star game but the controls are dumb in this version. I should have just emulated it. Akward touch screen controls slow down gameplay.
Love it.
Yeah it's fine, but you could just emulate the game for free with a snes emulator app. Reminder kids: you don't owe big companies a single cent.

Definitely one of the best games you can play on android. It has a solid story and gameplay, but do yourself a favor and play with a controller. On screen joystick makes a lot of the movement, battles and other gameplay harder than it should be. There's also some issues with dialogue. Still, this is one of my favourite games ever and it's been a blast playing on mobile.
tha besssssst snes game evr made
This game is genuis for early days of the rpg genre.
So far so good. Controls could've been a bit better. But definitely brings back those old 1990's memories of SNES. 💯😆👌
A perfect classic still to this day.
Game opens to a black screen on my Oneplus 8 Pro running Android 11. I don't know if my phone is too high end or something but I would prefer this be updated so I can play such an amazing game.

I can't even start the game? It keeps saying that I lost connection, but nothing seems to be the issue. This would probably be at least an easy 4 (or a 5 if it's a good port) stars from me if it could work properly. Otherwise, $10 wasted

I really enjoy this game alot and this is my first time playing the game, I was told about this game by one of my friends and I decided to play it. Sometimes there are really weird graphical bugs but it can go away when I leave and re enter the room and sometimes the controls suck but I rarely have problems with the controls, I have noticed that you guys haven't even abandoned this game and the last time you updated was in August. This is a great game just controls sometimes suck.
Amazing classic game. Given most of the negative reviews are giving the controls grief, I personally didn't think they were that bad.
If you like rpg you must play this game. It's one of the best games of all time.
Not playable w/o bluetooth controller. Poor touch screen navigation control.
Same fantastic classic but the d pad is horrendous....i expected so much more when indi devs can apply better controls to their games.
Old school favorite.

A genre defining RPG. Great story and fun, lovable characters. Only problem I had with this game is when using my Bluetooth game pad, the controls would randomly force me in one direction which required me to restart the game until I finally figured out a trick to fix it (jam in a direction a few times). It was pretty annoying but after I learned how to address it, it wasn't a big deal. I'm on a Pixel 3a.
Good controls, glad to play my favorite game again
Best turned based game I've ever played. Unless you played thousands year door er somefin.
Theres nothing bad to say here.

Amazing, one of the best games I've ever played. I'm not the biggest rpg fan -I only played pokemon as a kid- but Chrono Trigger is truly a masterpiece. I loved every minute of it. The optimization for playing on android is really good, with the exception that moving around sometimes is a little iffy; other than that, perfect. Do yourself a favor and play this game.
Great game
This isn't your average "mobile version". Other than some minor gripes with walking about in certain parts, everything works great. It's Chrono Trigger. I completed it, and enjoyed the experience.

Fun... Until you get stuck. If anyone can catch the rat with these controls, much props. I'm bummed I wasted $5. Been trying for 2 hours and get a tad stuck at nearly every turn and thus can't ever catch up to the rat.
Chrono trigger has been and always will be the best jrpg.
Great Game!
I mean it might be the best j-rpg or up there on the runnings. Thanks now i have it on my phone.

Not playable without controller? As others have noted, the control system is pretty bad, to the point where parts of the game requiring fast movement aren't possible. Sad to have spent money on this, only to find out I'll need a Bluetooth controller to play!
Love this, same feeling when i played it on snes
Played it on SNES, PC emulator, and now on mobile. Will continue to support this title!

Won't run on my OnePlus 6T, just stuck on black screen. Legit, this is my favorite RPG of all time and I'm super disappointed that it won't run at all on my phone. Would rate 5 star instantly if it was working.
Super , bring back memories

The dialogue has changed a great deal since the SNES and DS releases but alas the whole experience is just as enchanting as i remember! This game has always been a favorite of mine since i was a child. Thank you all so much!
What is the Japanese thing that is req permission to access my google account?

Missing a few sound effects here and there from the original, and some item names are different.. but the controls are well done and the port was pretty flawless. Recommend for playing on a touch screen (swipe the screen instead of tapping on what you want is more accurate)
Willing to update my review if this gets the PC patch that adds in the old graphics and UI :(

Near the end of the game, the game crashed and now the save file is a black screen, it won't load. Corrupted. A gamer's worst nightmare. My first experience with the game, and it ended like that. I was having a lot of fun with it, too. Good game, bad port.
No option to turn off the disgusting Bilinear filter, horrible default font too. Yep, this is an eyesore
537 mb?! The original game is 3.2 mb. What the hell.
It's very annoying because not every time I connect to internet. I couldn't play in flight
Great game, only complaint is I wish it had the arena option
Awesome classic!
I truly wish there was a setting for muting the sound. I need my phone sound on for work but can't play this if my sound is on. This will get the full 5 stars if this ever gets fixed.
Awesome Square RPG. That's all you need to know!!
Wipes out all saved and bookmarked data every time I exit the game. Not worth the $10.
It's quite a nostalgia trip. The virtual joystick is complete trash. If the implemented a configurable virtual d-pad/AXYB, it'd be perfect.

Also a childhood fav " used to play when I was little .. very tuff to complete the first time...once you do though .. you can do a new game + which is starting the game with all the stuff you finished it with.... And as far as I am concerned the only way to be able to truly say, you have ""clocked""huhaa get it chrono_(time,) clocked !??" Is to reach level★★for all characters.. very "time"consuming,"' however glad I can play on my phone!! Thanks square soft!!
Great Port had it on many devices and after all the work they have done its truly a finished product
Best game ever
One of my all time favorite games love it on my Super Nintendo game console: )
Great port and great game.
Loooovvveeee this Game from when it first released on SNES. Great transfer to mobile

As you can see by the rating, I am not satisfied with my purchase. The game has now wiped my save data twice, including my cloud saves. For a premium game, this kind of performance is unprofessional. I'd ask for a refund, but I actually want to play this game.. So I write this as a "buyer beware", this game is not worth your money, and you'd be better off looking for a Chrono port elsewhere. To Square Enix, we all know that you have the capability to produce quality products and services.
Solid game and plays great.
Amazing game.
BAD CONTROLS I WANT A REFUND ...

Regardless of what some people are saying I think this is my favorite version of the game simply because of the auto battle feature.Not to mention that it's got all the extra bosses from the DS version.I don't mind no cut scenes because I've already seen them all.Plus on mobile I can play anywhere instead of just at home.

How do I catch the rat? I give 3 stars because I am having a rough time with the controls. Especially catching the rat. I manage to run up to it, but I guess I have to manage to tap on it while I should be running too? Am I missing something? I will surely reconsider my rating if I manage to master the controls and maybe recieve a tip catching the rodent. Thx.

Horrific controls. Makes it such a chore just navigating the map. More frequent than not I find myself getting stuck behind things because of the bad controls. It made saving Luccas mom impossible, I couldn't even reach the password input in time because I got caught on the stairs. Yes, the controls are so bad you can get caught on the stairs, unable to move for 5-20 seconds at a time. You will spend a lot of time staring at your character shaking it's head at you because it can't move forward.
Beautiful games
Great port
Just as good as I remembered

Love the nostalgia of the game! For being on my galaxy s10e it plays great, the sound is amazing, and the graphics are what I would expect (not sure why there was so many complaints there). I have had issues with targeting but figured out a solution (same part everyone has trouble with I'd imagine) During the Ozzie fight in Magus' castle, instead of trying to tap the alt targets, drag your finger across the screen; it will take the cursor from one target to the other. Much easier.
And would like to install it on Android, but apparently I can't. At least it's small enough I could try a few times and still get a refund. Such a shame.
Doesn't even start, just closes, unimpressed
Love Chrono Trigger ever since i first played it as a kid on the SNES...anyone know if this has New Game+ included in this version?

Controls work fine (touch screen) and I've had no hick ups with the app crashing or anything. Sounds a d plays fine. If you've never floated the game and want to, or just wanna replay it then this is a solid experience. I find the story to be interesting, it's a solid Square Enid game.
This is a great update, everything works, best RPG ever
Legit, old school Rpg style, with decent controls and updated cut scenes and animations. 10/10 would firespin again
The story alone is worth your time. Never mind the music, style, and innovation this one produced in strides.
I'm so happy that my childhood classic is now on my phone it is so crazy that I once played this on a console now on my small phone
Best RPG ever! So happy it's on my phone!
Excellent classic game, very fun, sorely lacking a cloud save feature
Very Nostalgic

I had bought this game a while back and i tried to install it again after not having it installed for a while and its telling me i need to buy it again. I love this game and would wish to play it but i shouldn't have to buy it a 2nd time. 👎
Was having a great time but the game crashed and I lost all my progress so it's hard to recommend

They made me buy this game twice one time on my note phone, and then when I tried to download it on my tab to play it, it didn't register my payment even though it's in my library and won't download it unless I pay again, they want me to pay for a third time even though I own it. Please fix it devs, no wonder people use roms instead of this blatant theft.
One of the best games now on mobile (:

I want to start by saying Chrono Trigger is my favorite video game of all time. This port has all the great story, characters, gameplay and music of the original. If you are a fan, or have heard the myths about how good this game is, it is still worth every penny and is a must-have. However, the controls, even after updating, are still lackluster and a pain, and the graphics are tarnished by unnecessary filtering. It needs one more updates to add an ability to turn off filters.

Missing the option for the original (good) graphics that the PC has. Played for two minutes and too late for a refund I guess, so I'm stuck with this version that I'll probably end up never playing now.

I don't understand why this game isn't playable in widescreen, it's tiny on my phone, and I don't even have the option to play in Portrait like I'd hoped. After playing the original dragon quest on mobile this is a massive step down in comparison. I can't believe I paid £9.99 for this broken mess of an emulator.
Extremely nostalgic for me. Had an amazing time playing this
Just like the ps1 edition

Amazing port of the original game. The controls are VERY smooth and easy to understand. The Combat is so satisfying and intuitive. The soundtrack is also very amazing, each track is unique and memorable. The story is absolutely phenomenal. Plays smoothly even on a smart phone, which still blows my mind. Definitely worth every penny you pay for this game, and worth the storage space. 10/10 would recommend.
it keeps crashing when i try to retreave my clowde saved game regardless of device please fix it
The quick save almost always corrupts the save. The amount of this game I have played twice on android is insane.
I love chrono trigger
Best RPG ever
Boss adaptation on the android! Controls get a little sticky at times but super fun regardless.

Great game but the touch screen controls are not fine tuned enough. I mean chasing that thing on the girders is nigh on impossible. Up down left right is all that is needed for an old RPG like this. This 'rollerball' mechanic is just too fiddly and not precise enough.
After the update its now okay just need full screen
I had so much fun with this game. The mobile controls worked out very well once I got used to them. Awesome game, great port!
10/10 just buy it

Just amazingky nostalgic n plesent to play again with such ease
Great classic game. Controls are touchy and cost lives in boss battles which can be frustrating but overall I'm satisfied.

One of the best RPGs ever in your pocket! Touch controls work perfectly and it's by far the most convenient (and affordable) way to experience this masterpiece. Highly recommend this mobile version!

Yes! My favorite game of all time on mobile. The touchscreen controls were practically made for this game. Graphics are upgraded from the DS port. Contains the animated cutscenes. If you are new to this game, or if you want to revisit a classic. This port will not do you any wrong.

Pure nostalgia. My favorite game of all time growing up. Get it. You won't regret it. Why are you still reading this instead of playing this game? GO!!! NOW!!!!
Bad control. battery drain. Graphics are ok but the game itself is awesome 👌 worth the money

This is an update to my review, which was originally one star. In May 2020, I was unable to properly save to or restore from the cloud. While I believe this version could still use some TLC, an update was pushed out specifically to tackle this problem and other issues after my reports to Square Enix support. They worked with me, back and forth, for months to fix the issue. In appreciation to their efforts, I'm bumping this from 1 to 4 stars.
This brings back so many memories ✌️
Always have loved this game! Now even more!
I do enjoy this game. But it honestly needs a tad more polish.
Excellent!!! 5 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟 🌟
Great port of an amazing classic. One of the top 5 greatest games of all time. Buy this. Support square.
Amazing game! The port also works pretty well on mobile, it occasionally has a few technical bugs, but nothing that hindered me due to the game having plenty of chances for saving.

The control is indeed awful, single minded and money grab at best. I want my $9.99 + pride back for purchasing a momento of my childhood back please.... There is No Thank You Seriously. Do let those whom have not enjoyed the past allow anything to do w/ manufacturing the future ! ! ! (Displeased emoji) Post. Mic drop. Get a rasberry is my best advice for..... Oh no.. Be.ing cut... Off... Ahhhhhh. Fword. My last words..... Squaresoft why?
Worth the price and just as fun as I remember when playing on the NES system. Controls take some time to get used to but once you get it down it's all gravy. Highly recommend.

Overall a great port, with a couple of minor quibbles: - tapping to switch targets during battle can be a nuisance, since the slightest mistap = action again the wrong target. Particularly annoying for things like the battles vs Ozzie. - likewise, field controls are generally good but areas that require precision movement like Death Mountain can be a bit annoying - the cinematic cut scenes should really be skippable on New Game + - the DS "extra content" is mostly annoying fetch quests

This game is absolutely amazing. Hands down the best RPG of all time, so very wholesome. I don't know what is up with the bad reviews of this android version but I just beat it a few minutes ago and the gameplay was absolutely flawless, exactly how I remembered. I have a cheap android phone that's less than $100 and I encountered zero problems whatsoever. They even added a feature where you can save at pretty much any time, anywhere and it works exactly as expected. Such a beautiful game.

This is so bad that it's not funny. Square Enix decided to "improve" the graphics by running them through a filter to make them look hand drawn. But if you look at groups of things, like a forest, they were drawn as 1 forest and split into tiles. Instead of putting the picture through the filter and then splitting them into tiles, they put each individual tile into the filter. So now things that are supposed to look seamless don't. Every stupid forest, stone whatever. They all look so bad now.

The game looks pretty, the sound and music is wonderful, it however fails in combat occasionally the touch mechanic by which you select enemies in combat feels very imprecise. There are times in the game where it is very important that you attack certain parts of enemies to avoid harmful repurcussions and this results in deaths that otherwise could have been avoided. The game also includes a wonderful quicksave feature perfect for playing on the go during short bursts
Loved this game growing up!!
Just like I played it 25 years ago on the Super NES! Hell yeah long live gaming!
The game is fun. I didn't have a problem finishing it.
Just finished my first playthrough. Such nostalgia. If you take the time getting characters built up you can easily spend 40+ hours here. I finished the game in like 33 hours. Great game, great port.

Love the game. Brings back my childhood. I previously complained about the difficulty of selecting specific targets. By trying to tap directly on them its still ridiculous however now that im aware if i just swipe i can go thru targets till i get the one i want its much more enjoyable. Still find the menus during battle a bit qwerky however....good port overall.

Compré el juego solo porque vi en el video de youtube que tiene los videos anime de la versión de PS1 y resulta que el juego es la versión que salió en la SNES, sin videos animados, tremenda estafa promocionar un juego con los videos que no tiene. This port is almost good now. It still needs a better font wouldn't be hard to do, and an option to turn off the pixel filter is essential. The requirement to always have an internet connection—or in the case of some of your titles–to actually have the game download in parts as you progress—are both draconian forms of DRM and are UTTER BULLS**T!!!

Great nostalgic game. I had this game in SNES, PlayStation One and on the mobile. I don't know I want more of this came.
Excellent game..... Hope this game will last long....

I have the Note8 and pair my xbox controller to my phone to play this game and IT IS AMAZING!! All these bad reviews must have terribly underpowered devices because I've had no issues so far with bookmarks or saves. No black screens or crashes. I'll get secret of mana next as that is my all time fav but CT is def a close 2nd. If you have a good phone you shouldnt have any issues with this game! If you have the Note8 like me this game is flawless!

Still a great game, but the controls are often annoying. If I miss a tap it just confirms whatever action on the default enemy, which is often not what I intended. This is especially annoying on battles like Ozzie when it doesn't give any indication where to tap, so although I knew the strategy I still lost the battle the first time just trying to figure out exactly where to tap.
Bought controller just for this game alone -Android controller works but Needs iOS controller support (so far as I know), favorite game and have on all platforms, love new game+
Used to be 2 stars in 2014, but now in 2020 it doesnt crash when I go to lockscreen anymore. Finally a playable experience.
This game is just as good as it was back on the SNES

Update: Game unplayable. Once app starts mandatory download unavailable| Chrono Trigger is my absolute favourite game ever. This port is at best average, to badly done. The original game was lovingly created and felt perfect. This feels slap dash. I can't believe they've actually reduced the options that used to be available in the 16-bit version. I've no idea how SquareEnix turns out bad games, one after another... Remember how good the software was during the Squaresoft days... What happened?
New Controls and extra features on a HD high tech Screen that is spectacular I would not have thought in a million years this would be enjoyed on a HD Phone like this we truly are in the Future lol.
Love this game. But the controllers are glitchy. I'd pick cure or something and instead itd be ice instead and I'd kill my own player.
I Love Chrono Trigger, easily one of the best games of all time, but its just not great to play on phone, in my opinion at least....

Currently unusable black screen can't start a new game. This is one of my all time favorite games. But like many of the other square Enix games on Google play they are sold at a premium 10 dollars and up and then forgotten. Please for the love of all that is in your history. Maintain your damn standards. And update things. We paid for this not to be a fleeting experience but for it to be a mobile access when we want where we want. And with the millions of purchases I'm sure you can afford upkeep

Controls suck and its demotivating to play because of it.
I can't recover my progress. The app cracks everytime I try to download the progress from the cloud.

Chrono Trigger is one of the best story driven JRPGs one can play, and for the most part this was a fantastic port to mobile devices. That said, the controls for this game suffer a bit - specifically in regards to moving the character around in precision activites. There also seems to be some issues when coming back to the app after snoozing the phone and eternal black screens happening from time to time. However, I was able to get the majority of the experience when playing this game.
dont waste your money on this port. The catch the rat in the ruins level is impossible to beat using a touch screen. The game does not allow external bluetooth game controller.
It's just like I remembered is on DS, maybe even better and am working on 100% it.
Love the game, the app keeps crashing when I open cloud saving on my phone and tablet. Its frustrating

I was a little disappointed with the whole thing all together but Chrono trigger is my number one favorite game of all time. This is basically the super Nintendo version only, it has no cutscenes though out the game at all and it doesn't have the arena mode from the DS, the only good point about it is that I can now play my favorite game on the go whenever. It did crash ALOT when I first got it once that works its self out the only constant issue is the controls get you stuck demanding a reboot
Not sure why the complaints, ran fairly well, interface was ok, and the nostalgia could not have been realer.

Don't buy this game. Doesn't worth it. It sucks. The interface sucks. The controls is bad. It's impossible to beat Millennial Fair Show tent mini game. The visual even worse. I should have using snes emulator instead of this garage. Can't even get refund.

The game works well, looks good, and - while the touch controls aren't the best - it supports my Xbox controller with no issue. I grew up playing this classic game on the Super Nintendo, and it's nice to be able to play it on the go without having to carry around a DS.
Two thumbs up
I thought the controls need more credit its not the D'S or snes but a good tablet game

Save game loads into a blank screen now. Even if I make a new game. That's disappointing. Only work around I've found is to transfer the game data to the sd card. That'll let you load once. Then any other attempt will be a black screen again. For whatever reason transfer back to the phone then back to the sd will give you another load in a pinch.
I had this game as a kid, and it was so fun at the time. It still is!!! I love it sooo much!!! I'd highly recommend this game, I you can, please play it!!!!

I played this game with an 8bitdo controller. That made the experience significantly better over the screen controls. Great game overall and the rating should really be 5 stars, but glitches are too hard to ignore. The game will crash from time to time so save early and often. Theres a feature to start via bookmarks (think of it as a save anywhere feature without need save points). This feature is a great idea but poorly executed. I do not use it because it has failed to load so often.
An excellent port of an excellent game

Otimo jogo. Consegui zera-lo sem nenhum problema siguinificante, tive uma pequena dificuldadepra me acostumar com os controles porém foi algo bem momentâneo. Peguei na promoção e ñ me arrependo! ps: peguei em promoção :p
Seems to work great for me
The game is awesome, that is why we want to play it also on mobile, but is filled with glitches and has not been updated since two years ago. This price for a game that does not work? Just a rip off

It's a great game. Most of us know that... But the controls are terrible. Also wish I'd known it didn't have the cinematics they added to the psx version. I'd refund it but it took me a couple days to get around to playing enough to realize.
Horrible controls. What a shame.
6 hours in and my save file loads only a black screen. Resume function has the same problem most times. Controls are clunky, targeting in battle is bad. Back to the beginning I guess.

The touch screen controls are glitched. The Guardian fight is unnecessarily dufficult due to my characters no longer attacking my intended target. I have the same problem with healing. I will no longer spend money on a Square Enix product again. You have lost a lifelong customer.
I love this game a lot.
One of my favorite games on snes happy to be playing it on my phone

Completely satisfied with this replay experience

All characters vary, all bringing something individual to their story/combat. Combat system is fun, utilizing either individual abilities or a team attack to devastating effect. Port is good 👍

An imperfect port of a close to perfect game. Chrono Trigger was released in 1995, but it will be a treasure forever. The story is reminiscent of The Time Machine by H. G. Wells. This game is so enthralling that it made me cry. One of the best ports that touch controls can allow. It can be difficult to learn at first, but once you get the hang of swiping around to move and tapping to interact, it's not so bad. An important tip is that you can move with one finger and tap with the other, which makes certain instances way easier.Good graphics, few bugs, nice cinematic cutscenes and a faithful translation from the Japanese version. The only way to get a better experience is through PC or DS. It does the job surprisingly well for a phone game, which is what my standards were lowered for with this review.

In short this is a great port of the legendary Super Nintendo game. Touch controls are okay but not great (esp in active combat and puzzles), but that's the roughest edge here. For those new to the game, welcome to one of the most gobsmackingly beautiful 16-bit games of all time. This game is overflowing with charm, humanity, and ambition. A must play for RPG fans!

While this is a great port in many ways, it has some issues. The new translations in some cases either obscure the intent of the text (Ayla's jumbled text about dying, then having a baby, then making Kino chief, apparently in that order), or they reframe beloved characters in an uncomfortable light (such as Frog now being sexist because of poorly constructed dialogue, particularly the first time he interacts with Flea.) The controls are also loose and awkward, which can make several of the challenges where precision control is a factor virtually unplayable. This could be solved with added controller functionality, such as MOGA compatibility, but there do not currently appear to be any such options available. Visually the game is an improvement, with the classic graphics retained but polished, and the anime cutscenes from the Playstation and later ports included. I'd love to call this a unanimous improvement, but unfortunately the significance of the issues in the translations and controls make this just okay. I wouldn't consider it a step up over an SNES ROM on a decent emulator or any of the other portable ports of the game. I purchased this in the hopes it would help show Square-Enix that there's a lot of love for this game still, and to hopefully encourage them to work on a remaster or remake for the Nintendo Switch, but if they were to direct port this particular version to another platform, I would not buy it again.

The controls are awful at points. For example, the controls for select an 
enemy to target are fiddly at the best of times, and usually downright 
non-sensical. It is often almost impossible to actually select the correct 
enemy. This would be annoying in any game but since the battles are in real 
time, you don't actually have time to try and select the correct thing, and 
thus all strategy of what to hit goes out the window. Because of the mode 
which allows you to pause battle when selecting techs, it isn't such a 
problem, but it is still difficult with normal attacks. The other issue I 
had was with the coloured button system used for minigames. It isually 
works well but with minigames where speed is imperative (specifically the 
copying minigame) you often spend too much time looking for where on the 
screen the correct button is, and thus lose completely. Credit where it's 
due though, chrono trigger is still a really fun game, despite these flaws.

is TERRIBLE. More advanced Android users may be frustrated when they find 
out that the game will not run if you have xposed enabled. Overall I would 
say it is not worth the $12 (or even $5). Don't waste your cash, grab a ps1 
emulator and the Chrono Trigger iso for a better experience.

First of all, there are massive amounts of misdirection in the review 
options alone. That aside, the game is a huge flaming pile of dog - - - -. 
Simply put, I've played this game since its first release, and never once 
have I had any difficulty doing a simple thing like moving or clicking a 
button. This game takes play control to a new low standard. I've a dozen 
screen shots and live recordings of me in the first area (fair grounds 
festival) clicking the buttons for the 40 silver point challenge. It fails 
even when you hit them a good % of the time for no reason other than, as 
mentioned, this game being a complete pile of dog - - - -. Moving is 
another issue. Hold down the awkward fumbling joystick and stay still, or 
get no response at all half of the time. Why not just use the touch screen 
and touch like in every other third person game out there now... Diablo 
been doing it for ages... Why can't you, Squeenix? Huh? Your eyes too tight 
or something to see the glaring problems with your port? Don't buy this 
garbage, get an emulator and run the original. At least those work.

I played this game when it originally came out, long ago, so I got a phone 
a few months back that could actually handle it, and downloaded it. I love 
it, it's as fun as I remember in my childhood. The music, the story, the 
boss fights, Lavos.. amazing. I was worried it might be hard to play on a 
phone but to my surprise it was easy enough to get used to, Death Peak and 
the prehistoric hunting grounds where you chase Nu around were the most 
difficult to traverse, but not too bad. I used a guide on Wiki to play 
through, I recommend it, helped me a lot. I had no problems whatsoever with 
this game, loading or whatnot. NOTE TO THE DEVELOPER: One request, please 
add different backgrounds/colors that we can choose/ switch in the menu 
area. Like the text box colors and stuff.

I was super stoked to play this game after beating it for the first time a few years ago. It's just unfortunate that you don't get the whole game in the first download. After playing through the opening scene a dozen times (every time your game is interrupted by a notification you lose any unsaved data) and not being able to save, I finally made it through the first area with actual enemy encounters. Once I got through the first 4 battles the game prompted me to download the next area, only it wouldn't download. After exiting the prompt I was taken to the main menu and lo and behold my game wasn't saved! So I'm going to have to play the opening scene AGAIN! Having to be connected to WiFi to play this "mobile" port makes me wonder why I didn't just bother downloading this illegaly since I can't play on the go and will only make progress while I'm on my home network (like I would be on a desktop computer.) Sorry Square Enix, your lack of respect for customers has left me with a sour taste in my mouth, I will not be making any more purchases until you resolve your DRM issues. 2 stars because CT is one of the greatest games ever, but look elsewhere to get your classic RPG fix.

Those who suggest to emulate this will miss out on the extra features from this port (2 new dungeons, new ending, etc), so don't go that route. I put over 30 hours into a playthrough of this port and it was great from beginning to end. Quick advice, If you want to play offline, just have your data on for starting the game and then switch it off during gameplay. Do not miss out on this game, it is one of the all-time greatest.  EDIT: Cloud saves have finally been implemented and I was able to bring my 2014 save into my new phone. 5 stars for the continued support.

The world of it's okay  *this* Is emphasis okay? Okay.  This game is so weird to me. One of the newest feature they have is whenever you leave your game, anywhere your character enter through a door or enter a new place, your game will start you up back there through the newest resume function. Making this game very enjoyable for short bursts and couldn't save it before you leave your game.       A game controller is highly recommended for the experience, and if you play games on your phone, most likely, you already have one. The game itself is a timeless classic, worth more than five stars, but this port of the game is not... There are several bugs in the current version (the new release of Feb 2018). External gamepad support is incomplete/bugged so that some things are impossible to do with gamepad. eg: leading the lost cat back to the girl at the fair. It only follows when talked to by touch or mouseclick, but runs away if talked to by gamepad 'A' button. Another bug relates to text entry of character names, which does not display the default names in the text entry fields (entire entry field is just grey). Each default name is displayed only AFTER it has been chosen through the 'Accept' button. Possibly that bug is due to invalid dependency on some specific GPU (needs to be generic). Also, the game completely ignores name entry from external keyboard (USB). And these are just the bugs I noticed after a few minutes of gameplay. I'll report further bugs as I proceed into the game... An additional bug is that the easternmost section of Guardia Forest 1000AD is rendered as a 4:3 segment of the full 16:9 screen, with wide vertical black borders on both sides of the rendered segment.

Beaten the game multiple times now, with limited issues. The only real issue I have is that the climb death peak starting section is pretty obnoxious using a phone but is quite doable. The people on here saying it's unplayable are either experiencing an issue I've not encountered once on 4 separate playthroughs or they are lying. As for the ones complaining about save points, I can only imagine that they weren't around when all games were like that. You can save from the world map at any time and there are multiple save points in each area you travel through. It's an older game, and that's how games were at the time. If walking back to a save point that is maybe 2 minutes away is too hard, then this is probably not the game for you. If you're wanting to replay this game as it was (with minor updates like touch screen) then this is the one for you. The emulators I tried before I found this on the store all caused hassles but it's been smooth sailing since I found this app. Thanks to everyone to helped make this app and please get Chrono Cross on here next so I can die happy Edit: The dlc "issue" yes you will have to download more of the game. My experience was 3 downloads across a 40+ hour runthrough. Not exactly the nightmare some of the whiners on here are making it out to be but indeed an issue if you lack access to WiFi at the couple times it wants to do it. Never had to download anything else after. It's a shame to see some of the complaints on here considering how trouble free the excessive amount of time I've spent playing the app has been. I'm normally pretty rough on judging games but I saw no major issues as long as you're patient with dlc (2-3 minutes of downloading at max and only a couple times total) and don't go into a frothing convulsive rage the second you don't get your way like some of the reviewers. My favorite review is the guy who claims there's no save option and after 20 minutes he rage quit. (Save feature is in the menu tab so they apparently never tried looking there lol)

Okay lot of bad reviews so here is what I have to say. It does crash if you let your screen lock but. If you sit down with intention to play. Please fix the crashing. The game crashes anytime I lock my phone, which is why it's not perfect. If this major issue were to be fixed, I would change the review score. Outside of the shortcomings, it's a wonderful game. I've played the original on the SNES, so this is a walk down memory lane.

Classic RPG marred by atrocious touch controls. Movement tasks that require both speed AND precision are effectively impossible, thanks to a digital joystick that floats to wherever the thumb touches, even if leaves it partially offscreen and unusable in the process; locking the stick to a set point isn't an available feature either. Further complicating this control mess is the need to directly tap what you want to interact with, instead of a discrete button in a corner. SE really screwed the pooch here, and no fix is in sight.

The app is terrible.  Chrono Trigger is one of the best games ever made, but this port to Android is just terrible.  There is currently no cloud save like other Square games. Great Game with Serious DRM issues.     I love this game and was excited to play it on Android.  However, I discovered the hard way, that the DRM makes offline playing impossible.   I downloaded the game and installed before a transatlantic plane flight.   I started the game and it authenticated fine.  After an hour or a half or so, I put the phone to sleep.  When I wanted to resume play after about 30 minutes, I kept getting an Authentication Failed error.  Completely disappointing as I bought the game SPECIFICALLY to play on long trips in zones without internet.    Until this is fixed, the port is crippled.

I've played every version of this game and the game itself has always been worthy of a classic. The controls take some getting used to. Targeting in battles is unintuitive. Poor coding in this port doesn't prevent idle to sleep and restarts when returned to. This can often lead to lost play time.

I've had to replay the telepod sequence three times because I kept having to flip away and do something else, and the game would reset upon my return.  Otherwise it's the same old game. This is not a review of the game. This is a review of this app version of the game. Chrono Trigger itself has always been one of my favorites. I have played through all of its versions throughout the years.  This application is terrible. Between the DRM constantly checking in on you and the fact that you cant just install the whole game but need to take breaks to download new areas this is not able to be an app used on an offline device for very long. The game has been modified for touch controls but they made it not support game pads. The digital joystick is very iffy, making certain spots throughout the game frustratingly difficult. This game doesn't crash very often as long as you do not leave it to multitask but the times it does crash are aggravating due to the way they maintained the classic save game methods, so remember to save often.

This game has always been on of my FAVORITE Square-Enix games. Constant fun and its always entertaining. A superb soundtrack, spectacular story, and epic gameplay, this game will entertain you for hours and hours. I only wish that there was a better sequel than Chrono Cross.   Controls will take some getting used to since the game has been optimized for touch, I would not recommend this to anyone using a device with a small screen since some text can be a little hard to read, but it does work well. The onscreen joystick is wonderful, a little weird to work with at first, but very happy that they did not incorporate a D-Pad or ABXY buttons since it would take up valuable screen space. My only wish is that when you are in a battle, it would be very helpful if you could move the stat screen from the bottom to the top, and vice versa as you can in the SNES version of this game.  Overall, a 5 star rating for a 5 star game! Great job and keep up the great work.

CLASSIC, super-massive RPG spanning across several time eras and dimensions! Aside from the main mission of defeating Lavos, there are also lots of other interweaving storylines, sidequests and mini-games that provide for hours and hours of gameplay (and grinding ;-) ). This is almost a world unto itself! Personally, I thought a lot of the Techs and Items were very needless, and the turn-based battle system could use some shortcuts. But otherwise, the game is excellent in its own retro way.
Finally playable on my phone again

And that was just my first pun! Seriously though, this is the best RPG ever made, with over 40 different endings depending on when/where you beat the game, and it was one of the first RPGs to include a New Game+ feature. Even if it does require an internet connection, that only drops my rating to 5 instead of the 6 stars this game deserves.

Try to get it on another console if you can but it's still worth playing on mobile if you have no other options.

Okay, this game seems to be fun, but seriously, make it easier to suspend a session. Every time I put my phone to sleep to talk to someone for a second or accidentally hit the home button when sliding my finger around to move, the app *completely* closes and I'm forced to start over from my last save point. At least make the game create a bookmark when that happens! I really want to like this game, and I can live with the strange movement system and the awkward battle controls; heck, I can even live with the game needing to download individual portions if it would at least give you some warning and a save point before it did so, but I've had to replay so many parts in the first two chapters of the game due to poor implementation that my excitement is wearing thin incredibly quickly. My plan was to buy this and a few other of the old Square Enix games-turned-apps, but if they are anything like this, then I can't allow myself to buy them. I feel like a lot of this programming was meant to prevent piracy, but if that's the case, then it is seriously backfiring, because now I'm considering just getting an emulator for all these games instead of actually giving you guys more money.

I fail to see how a game which could fit on a single snes cartridge, which could only store a couple of megabytes at best, can't be downloaded in one go on a modern machine with gigabytes of storage and memory.  Long story short, the game will occasionally stop to tell you that it needs to download "additional content". But in reality this is just a form of half-assed drm by square enix, requiring you to always be online to play a game that you should be able to take anywhere with you.  Should square enix decide to deny the drm thing, I would like to remind them that google allows gigabytes of additional data per application that can be downloaded automatically by google play during installation, so there isn't an excuse for this.  Also, since it's supposed to run on a phone, stuff can happen that requires your attention such as a call or a text or something. You'll be pleased to know that this game does not support multitasking in any way shape or form. If you switch to another app and then switch back, the game starts from the very beginning as if you had completely closed it

Obviously the game is great; I played it on the SNES.  I don't understand why it needs an internet connection to authenticate every time the app opens? Latest edit: Doesn't even launch anymore (Nexus 5, 4.4).  It's a great game. But if you're trying it for the first time, don't buy this. Buy the DS version, or hell, even the SNES version if you can find it. The game is there, but there are several glaring problems.   What is up with the intermittent content downloads? They happen every few areas at completely bizzare locations. This was a SNES game originally; where did the file size bloat come from?  The controls are sometimes thought-out, but are just tacked on in other locations. Why am I able to tap on menu items directly, but to select an enemy I need to slide my finger on the virtual control stick?  Finally, and this is the part that I was most disappointed about, but the soundtrack was botched for no good reason. Instead of full tracks looping in the background, they cut off early and fade out, only to restart again from the beginning. As a game that was praised originally for its soundtrack, this is terrible. There's still hope, Square. You just have to fix this up.

You have to start over from the beginning. 2) Requires constant connection -- if you lose connectibility, you are kicked out of the game. That means, forget playing this game on plane (without paying the overpriced in-flight internet, where it's not even available in a lot of flight) and any places you don't have wi-fi or phone connection.  It brings back good memories, but these things prevent me from enjoying the game. Please fix.

I was and AM thrilled to play this game on my phone without an emulator mucking things up. This is my #1 game of all time. I love that the menus and battle screens are optimized for the phone, and the swiping and navigation is brilliant in those respects.  However, two major problems knock 2 stars right off the top.  1. If the screen locks the game will crash and spit you back to the start screen...regardless if you've saved recently. My interim solution is to plug it into a power source and set "do not sleep when plugged in", that way I can walk away for a minute to hit the bathroom or what not without losing all my progress....but this needs a fix fast!  2. The phantom directional is great and all, but is barely equal to most emulator buttons. It is very difficult to slot your character into those hard to enter buildings...entering guardia forest alone could take you 10 seconds of tinkering with how Crono is moving....not cool.  Like I said, this is my #1 game of all time, and this port is decent. I would suggest playing it on your computer with a controller, but this is good enough for on the go Chrono.

Square failed to deliver a decent port of this awesome game.  - Obnoxious DRM: Can't start the game without Internet connection. - No option do download the whole game at once, so you don't have your game play interrupted. This interruption also comes with no warning, and once the download is requested you can't go back. So unless you know the download checkpoints beforehand or constantly saves the game, you may end up losing progress if you can't start the download when required. - Save games are not sent to the cloud and cannot be backed up without rooting the phone. - No CGs. - Lacks all the extra features added in the DS version, the only thing kept were the lame dungeons - Dimensional Vortex and Lost Sanctum, which are terrible to begin with. - Not supported on common devices, such as mine Galaxy S3. Well, it's Chrono Trigger, one of the greatest RPG's ever made.  I won't bother reviewing the game.  This port, however, I have a few things to say about.  First: Clunky Interface - I get that we're trying to emulate a SNES pad on a touch screen, but the virtual joy pad doesn't respond well.  If it were fixed in place, one might have a better chance of controlling how the character moves, but it appears wherever you put your left thumb, meaning you can't just tap in a direction, making movement awkward.  Second: No save state. This isn't an SNES we're playing on.  These are portable devices.  We aren't sitting at home, we're on the go and for some of us, these are phones, where we might get a call.  The original save system was intended for a console, not for portability.  A save state would help us immensely.  Third: As far as I can tell, there are no graphics or sound options.  Now I understand that only so much can be done with an old game like this, but it would be nice to have options for scaling and some means of adjusting the volume of the game itself.  Overall, I give this a two-star rating.  Chrono Trigger may be legendary, but this port is only so-so.

Chrono Trigger is pretty much universally considered one of the best games of all time, so I don't feel the need to talk about the game itself. How does it run on Android?  The graphics are significantly improved over the SNES version, but we've been absolutely spoiled by FF's Android debut with FFIII, and other games like Chaos Rings. The touch-screen implementation is pretty dang weak. You lose a great bit of precision with the 'auto-stick', and the battle system is sloppy and takes a while to get used to (i.e. pressing the enemy you want to attack does nothing - you have to press the "Target" button to switch enemies). It's hardly broken, but I can't help but feel the development team could have knocked out something better in half an hour. Once you get used to it, you'll be fine. The DRM is insane. You must have an internet connection to start the game, and the internet connection must be active at all times. Why? Because the games downloads portions of the game as you play. This does stop a few hours in, though. Square-Enix completely knocked it out of the park with FFIII in terms of execution, and they set the bar incredibly high for themselves. This game does not come close.

I am improving my score because they fixed this issue, but I am not going to give this game the score the game itself deserves because there are still issues. Why did it take so long to fix a game that everyone said was broken? Why force DRM that is so ridiculous that it makes the game incompatible for even devices that should work? Why no game pad support for something that could effortlessly use it to great effect? Why SO long in between basic updates to expand compatibility beyond just the fatal bug ? Buyer beware, while Chrono Trigger is an excellent game, Square Enix is no longer a trustworthy company.

The content of the game itself remains quite good; the current implementation hasn't broken that.    All of the new "features" make this a waste of money, though.    The Bad: 1. The controls aren't very precise and going through menus and battles can be tricky at times.  Not a dealbreaker, though.  2. Online authentication required to start the game.  This irritating as you need to remember to launch it and switch away from the application if you intend to use it anytime you are not able to be online (such as inside an airplane!).  The Ugly: 1. The game does not download all the cache files you need at once.  This means you can't play more than about 1 era at a time before needing to go online again, which makes playing it anywhere with poor or no cell signal impossible.  Irritatingly, the first time it does this to you is right before the first time you can save after time travelling causing you to lose all progress.    These flaws should be part of the application description.  I should have waited for reviews before purchasing as I have wasted my money.  Good game if you can live with the limitations.  Me?  I want my ten dollars and time back.

Out of Space for review. Its Chrono Trigger, and worth it.Game is a good port except for:  The controls take a lot of time to get use to. The Joystick anywhere method is great in theory but it took an entire play through to get use to it. The mini-games are almost unplayable at first until you get use to the controls. This just takes time to get use to.  Downloading of the additional content. A bit annoying, but there are only 3 places this happens and really, the original game was only 3mb, what in the world is 240mb total? Internet required to start the game due to Market check. I typically want to play games when I don't have access, this is a rather stupid form of DRM and quite annoying.  Random slowdowns. I have no idea what causes this and I was unable to fix it. Sometimes the game will just slow down to a crawl, music is fine, sound effects play on queue, top doesn't show any additional processor usage from the game, it just slows down. It seems to correlate with loading of new textures/areas but is easily worked around by pressing the back button (exit game) waiting 2-3 seconds and hitting no, clears it right up. This is especially painful during animation sequences.

When I saw Chrono Trigger on  the market for $10, I thought it was an outrage. Here's the thing though, this isn't a simplistic game for your phone like Rebuild or Angry Birds. This is a full featured console RPG. The touchscreen interface took some getting used to, but now I like it.

Chrono Trigger is a fantastic game and I've been having a blast replaying it. I've clocked about 10 hours now, long enough to figure out the shortcomings of this particular port. The graphics look okay — not as crisp as I would prefer, but at least anti-aliased a bit. The touch screen menus are a bit awkward but eventually I got used to them. I like the new translation — I didn't play the DS version so this is my first experience with it. The biggest hiccup is the sound emulation. It's obvious the background music is looping digital audio files from the soundtrack, because they loop a couple of times and then fade out before restarting. It's obnoxious if you are listening to a particularly long loop. Some of the sound effects play incorrectly; others feel very low quality (like the gate warp sound). It's unfortunate because the overall presentation is very good, except for these small flaws. Also, having to authenticate with the Play Store is ridiculous. My Nexus 7 is wi-fi only, so when I was travelling 18 hours for Christmas I couldn't play it.

Don't get me wrong- Chrono Trigger is worth it if you haven't played it.  However, I couldn't get past the name entry screen without encountering a porting oversight. Enter your name? When you begin typing, it inserts before Chrono without deleting it. I had to hook up a separate keyboard just to get the cursor to move to where I could delete the other part of the name. The porters didn't anticipate running on a device without a set of arrows, which is odd considering that the directional pad doesn't move Chrono: you have to use the on-screen joystick for that.  The on-screen controls are clumsy. It's hard to know whether you're going to move or use the "action". Of course, this is all irrelevant if you invest in a micro-USB or USB-OTG gamepad, but for many phones and tablets this game is barely functional.  I haven't proceeded far enough into the game to know if the rest of the functionality works. At the point where an android SNES emulator and a CT rom perform better than the native app, I'm not sure I care.  I paid for the game because I love Chrono Trigger, but now I'm regretting my purchase.

My touchscreen is a bit finicy sometimes, and I think some on-screen controls might have worked a little better than the ones currently used. Having to always download more data whenever you get somewhere new in the game is extremely annoying, too. There is no excuse for a game like this to take that much space, and to keep needing more. The original SNES game is nowhere near this large. I can't play if I'm somewhere that I don't get excellent reception, because it needs to download more files every time I advance in the game.   If you're hurting for space, or you need to watch your data consumption, you're better off finding a rom and an emulator. It's nice to have an accessible, always handy copy of Chrono Trigger, and when I'm bored, I'll fire it up. But there are a lot of things they could have done differently to make it a more playable port.

Chrono Trigger is without a doubt my favorite game. With an amazing story, characters designed by Akira Toriyama (of Dragonball fame), and a huge game world this is a fantastic game. Combine that with a musical score that can at times make you happy, bring a tear to your eye, and occasionaly give you goosebumps (Google Frog's theme, you'll see) and this is a must own game. The only thing keeping it from five stars are as few annoying technical issues. Having to download the game in small chunks at random times is very frustrating especially if you aren't near WiFi while you are playing. It also does not work with several of the more popular tablets. Bottom line if you have a supported device this will be a great game and a much loved purchase. If you don't have a supported device I highly recommend picking the game up on one of the other platforms it is on, iOS, Wii store, Nintendo DS, Sony PlayStation store, the PS1 version, or the original SNES. You absolutely will not be disappointed.

I loved Chrono Trigger on the SNES when I was a kid, and for the most part the game is the same with some glaring mistakes that make for a terrible experience. Having to be online just to launch the game is unacceptable; my SNES didn't need to be online to play, and if I'm not near Wifi, (where I do the majority of my game playing), I can't play unless I tether my tablet. At seemingly random points during the game, you're forced to download the next scenario (The SNES ROM is like 4mb, so there's no excuse for this).  There is no progress bar, and the download is slow and non-optional.  If you happen to be trapped without connectivity, you have no choice but to quit without being given the opportunity to save your game.  No option is even given to download the game, or even play offline. The control is wonky to say the least, but serviceable.  Battle scenes are impossible sometimes because the characters do not attack where the cursor is, and the wait/active menu option seems to have no effect. Obviously, this is Squenix cashing in on an old franchise but not giving gamers what they really want.  The music and graphics are still beautiful, but that's about all.

Only difference is I'm running an Acer Iconia, and they haven't marked it uncompatible... yet. Sloppy work. Have yet to hear from developer too... What happened to square making decent games? Update: they won't do anything to fix the issue. basicly told me they couldn't find an issue so I'm screwed out of 10$. Don't buy ANYTHING from them unless your willing to throw your cash away.

A brilliant game that brings back the nostalgia of the olden days ;D The conversion isn't bad, but why the game downloads data in stages is beyond me.
