It says "play anywhere" as in on the way to work where in the tunnel there is no internet access. And would have to pay for data anyway. Good job. I have never played the game so really looking forward to it anyway.
Requiring an internet connection for this is unacceptable. I can't play a game I paid for on the plane due to this. Unbelievable. Will not BUY another game produced by square until this is fixed.

Heeey I remember this game from back in the day day. Don't know what everyone else is complaining about because it works FLAWLESSLY on my HTC Sensation. Only downer is 10 bucks for this???? Oh well, Lucca' s time machine just dropped me off to 600 A.D
It's ridiculous that a company as large as Square Enix doesn't have enough resources to support this on the S 3. Paid for it on one android device then upgraded to find out I wasted my money.. great

I was just thinking about how long it has been since I tried this on my Playstation.  Just like the origin except for movement is not as smooth and free.  Gotta give it to Square Enix for trying to protect their intellectual property.  It is their's, why complain about it.  The downloads are small and only take a minute.  And it does not take up extra memory space in the mean time.

I got this game so I could kill time during my 45min-1hour commute on the subway.  Well, without an internet connection it can't verify the app and doesn't let me load it.  I bought this the week it came out, hoping to play my favorite game ever, and DRM comes and slaps me, a paying customer in the face.  Do NOT purchase this until the DRM is changed.  My next course of action is to contact the developers and demand a refund or some sort of answer as to why this type of protection is required.
Please refund .
I loveeeee this game! Takes me down memory lane.

Extremely poor work porting... completely unlike FF3 available for Android. Many bug fixes and random crash fixes are still needed for improvement... this is very poor quality for a Square game release. Needs to remove downloading additional content and just provide the full game for download... c'mon FF3 was available as a 170+MB d/l.

Chrono Trigger is a classic RPG and it's great to finally get a version for Android devices.  Unfortunately, it seems to only work on smaller screens.  The game runs just fine on my Kyocera Rise cell phone, but does not scale properly on my Acer Iconia A200 tablet, as well as a cheap chinese Eken T10 tablet.  For the price of the game, Square-Enix needs to make sure it runs on tablets as well as phones.  The worst part of this is that when this game released there was no notice of this game not running on larger devices.  A few days after release, it pops up in the description.  Reading comments and editing the product description is not proper troubleshooting.  They did the same thing with their Chaos Rings release not working with rooted devices.  Bad move from a company that is charging a premium price for great games, because if these games don't work on your particular device, it's a good chunk of change wasted.
Once again you have brought back yet another of the Great RPG games..Square Enix has to offer.
I hadn't played this in 14 years. What a great game. Works really well on my S3.
I love this game

Screen is the wrong size on my Transformer tablet.  Cannot download extra files.  Here have a 1 star review.  *UPDATE* They responded to the incompatibility issues!  By making note that it is incompatible with a number of devices!  How cute.  What a waste of $10.  I really enjoyed this game and wanted to give Square some money for it.  They didn't even spit on it first.
Unusable, the screen is too small to do anything and the buttons to download the additional files are cut off due to the small screen.
It tells me authentication fail and kicks me out every time I start it ! what a waste I was looking forward to playing I should have just threw my 10 dollars away
Unusable starting screen - it is shifted to the left and down in a way that the on screen buttons are not visible. Galaxy Tab 8.9 with CM9.
Image is shifted over and down, hiding the buttons on the initial screens for downloading the additional content.  Works fine on Xperia Play (I can't find any option for button support though).

1.) You cannot play this game offline. The game needs to authenticate with a server in order for the game to launch. 2.) The SNES ROM is 4 MB in Size. Four Megabytes. Why does this game require a 35 MB download, and then request for more data to be downloaded IN THE MIDDLE OF THE GAME!? 3.) I would have prefered for there to be an on screen D-Pad with transparent buttons instead of the touch interface. It is very VERY clunky to control Chrono in this game and selecting attacks can be very cumbersome, especially on smaller screens.  I honestly should have saved my money and used it towards buying an SNES emulator and then just download the ROM of this game. I would have had a much better gameplay experience than this.   I give this crappy port of an awesome game a score of 1 out of 5.   Shame on you SquareEnix! Shame on you! :(
No tablet support and needs to be online all the time. I want to play this game on flights too. Why not a one time online activation. Ah. And scaling is not working at all. Useless.
Works great on nexus 7 as well

My favorite console game.  Ever.  I'm running it on my Galaxy S2 and it's beautiful, vibrant, runs smoothly, and is just fantastic.  If you have a nice phone and like RPGs, get it.  I'm sure on older phones it lags, but it just sings on mine.
Love this game!
I'm having the same problem as a lot of other people here, with the game freezing on a quarter screen. I hope square fixes this soon.

For all those who say you can't save anytime, you can. Its called bookmark and its right above save in the menu. I honestly have no trouble with the controls after I figured out you don't tap on a target to select it, but tap or drag left or right on the target button in the lower left. My only complaint is that after switching apps there is a black screen for a while, most of the time the game comes back, but maybe 1 out of every 6 times it takes me back to the title screen. I just make sure to save each time now
After installing and opening, the game ask to install additional data. Always fail to install additional data. Please fix it or refund my money.

When selecting enemies you have to use the options at the bottom left of the screen. You can't touch the enemy you want to attack. Everything is still done with through the menus   This game is a near perfect replica of any other version I've played. I've played the play station version which is the slowest version. The regular snes version is maybe the best version. And this version is nearly perfect. I don't know what it is optimized for but it runs flawlessly on my galaxy note 2.

Bought this game for something to do when the power went out for hurricane Sandy.  About half an hour after I lost power, I decided to boot it up and see what Chrono Trigger was all about, only to run straight into a request for a download of additional files.  Needless to say, I didn't get to try playing Chrono Trigger that night.  Two days later, I snagged some wifi access and downloaded the files, and when I went back home (still no power/internet) I played for about five minutes, whereupon the game asked for ANOTHER download.  I'm extremely frustrated by this (why can't it download all of the assets at once?) and the controls are a headache to use as well.  Furthermore, after checking the game today, it's now marked as incompatible with my device.  I would not recommend this purchase to anyone, and am highly skeptical of ever buying another square enix android product.

I was going to give this 4 stars for just the price alone. I gave this 3 for multitude of reasons. 1 no graphics upgrade. 2 sloppy touch controls for battle ( specifically location ). 3 l prefer the option to tap & attack the monster I want & not have to scroll. 4 the game is small so no cutscenes or slide show. 5 it seem to always check for something @ startup.On the bright side this game is fast and smooth as butter. I will test this on my tablet & let you know mood about that.

If you can get past about a half an hour learning curve for the controls, you won't be dissapointed in this great rerelease for such a trailblazing game.  Graphics and sound are more than sufficient considering the game is nearly 20 years old.
Lists as incompatible with my Nexus 7. Whatever.

Like many others this only loads in half the screen and i am unable to click any further. Pretty terrible for an expensive app. No mention of compatibility issues in the description. Patch or money back please.

I bought Chronotrigger a couple of days ago, after eagerly anticipating it from the time it was announced more than a year before. I installed the game, performed the mandatory wi-fi download, ensured that it ran and was eagerly looking forward to getting into it on a long international flight.   Imagine then my disappointment when the game refused to run without a network connection because of some boneheaded DRM/anti-piracy measure. Pirates will simply break this DRM and will happily run the game with or without a network, so the only people this hurts are legitimate customers.   Please remove this silly, pointless and anti-consumer restriction.

This game is awesome. Plays just like the original, the graphics are fine, and I've experienced no lag (like some users are complaining about). The one thing it could use is maybe an optional D-pad control.  I think some other reviewers complaining about the fact that the game has to be downloaded incrementally don't realize that this is a Play Store limitation, NOT the developers.

The DRM is some of the worst I've ever seen. Only the paying customers (like me) are punished. Don't spend anything on this until Square backs off. I thought I'd do the right thing after getting FF3 heavily on discount :-) but Chrono is the last game I'll be paying for from Square (not the last Square game I'll be downloading though). It's only a matter of time before someone stitches the downloads together. Square should sell the WHOLE game before someone else gives the full Chrono Trigger it away.
Screen is not properly optimized for tablets, and unable to move beyond the "download the additional resources", option.

Purchased this to play on tablet. Games doesn't scale properly, to the point I cannot even see the accept button to download additional data. If you are going to make a game available for a device, I dunno maybe test it first?
This is the best game ever, but the touchscreen interface needs a lot of work. There needs to be a better way to toggle run/walk and to target in combat. Still the best game ever though.

1) Can only display the language you want by changing system language, too bad.  2) Moreover, they can't recognize the system language <Chinese (Hong Kong SAR)> in Samsung Galaxy Note II as Chinese and use English in the game instead of... too bad for this... or maybe they do it in purpose? I don't know  3) For device with monitor ratio different with the game (e.g. the Note II again with 16:9 display), it is reasonable for blanking borders at two sides, but can the virtual controller available to be used/ detectable at the blanking part as well? It's so stupid to extend my thumb far to the center of my device in order to move LEFT without difficulties.  I agree this is an excellent game, but this app really needed to be largely improved.

Samsung galaxy tab 8.9 lte. The screen is the size of a mobile phone and its stuck in the left corner. Won't even let me enter the game. It tells me i need an update. Problem is that the screens composition wont let me agree. Real dissopointment, and with no refound this is just a cold slap to the face. Please fix this soon, or ur nothing but petty robbers in my book.

A very nice port!   Works great on my Galaxy S; the controls take a bit of getting used to, but, it's about as good as I think you can expect on a touch screen. You can use swiping in many places to actually make navigating equipment, items, etc. even more convenient than on the original.  Surprisingly easy on the battery and doesn't cause the phone to heat up like crazy like many other 3D-based games I've played.   One annoying thing is that you have to download data periodically to continue in the game -- how much trouble can it possibly be to load everything on installation?   Very much hopeful that a port of FFIV and FFIV will make it to Android...

I bought this the day it came out at the time it said it was compatible with all my devices, rest assured if you have a asus transformer tablet this won't work, and because of the refund policy I can't get my money back, do not buy if you own a tablet seems to have problems on them.

A good port even if the controls are a little sloppy. Very frustrating that I have to download more information during game play. I primarily play games when I don't have a signal. 1/11 one star. Connection required to play, no ability to quick save meaning if I have no connection and additional download is needed I have to start over. Disappointed I spent $10.
Cannot pass the initial download data screen

But please add an option to flip the screen! It's so uncomfortable to play games on my phone in default screen position due to awkwardly placed headphone jack. Minus another star for unresponsive controls.

I don't play games on my phone, but this is one of my favorite games. It is still great. The controls seem fine to me, the graphics are fine, and it's Chrono Trigger. The only negative point I have is that it lags... A lot, but maybe that's just my phone

Chrono Trigger is a great game, but this port doesn't feel very polished. Instead of re-thinking and re-designing the controls for a touch-based device, the devs seemed to just hack touch support into the engine. Menus are fairly clumsy to navigate through, The UI during battles feels a lot harder to use than it should. That, and smaller issues like blurry sprites, re-worked dialogue (I preferred the original dialogue in a lot of cases), and slow loading & saving all combine to make this a fairly mediocre port.  If you're a huge fan of the game, then it's still not a bad buy. I can't really say I recommend it for anyone else, though.

There should be  spot for 0 stars because this is what this app is. It stipulates in goole play that it is compatable with my Acer 500.  Yet, the app won't open. I gave square enix ten dollors for a busted app
Love the original, bought the game from a buddies phone to support. Please make it work on the gs3 soon so I can play it lol
I played for an hour looking for the save spot stars, but they didn't show up where I expected them... sadness
Not compatible with experia play gamepad.

This is the greatest game of all time but I'm afraid my complaints with this port are the same as most everyone else's... downloading new area being the worst (going through the portal for the first time is a WiFi check, probably to prevent .apk piracy.)  The lack of gamepad support is really a deal breaker.  The adaptive touchscreen gamepad is clever and all but I find myself wandering into the bezel way too often.  I'm going to hold this fifth star hostage until USB/Bluetooth gamepad support comes out.
Its a very good port of a classic rpg. Just another game for those long trips. Would have been five stars had it not been for problems of selecting which enemy to hit.

This would be my first time playing this game, so I cannot comment on the port aspect. It plays very well, and while the controls took a bit to get used to, they are excellent once you get the hang of them. I like that I can switch which side of the screen I use to control on a whim.  As others have mentioned, if android closes the app down, you lose your progress. I bookmark/save often, or turn on airplane mode while playing, if I don't need to communicate. (Airplane mode only helps you when you have the current area loaded. So far I've only had to load a single area).   The game it self is excellent, though I'm only 2.5 hrs into it. I find myself getting attached to the characters and already have an emotional stake in the game. I'm actually interested in the story, and not just the gameplay.  The battle system is awesome. I love that I can actually bump off some people with out actually entering combat. I love that I can sneak past some battles. I love that the battles take place on the map.  All and all, highly recommended.
Game crashes to frequently. Unplayable, waste of money. Get an emulator and play the original. Eff you square

I was super excited to see this hit the Android market. However, the fact you have to download game data as you play stinks pretty bad. I have a long international flight coming up next week and would have really liked to play this game during the flight. Also, the controls are a bit iffy. I keep getting stuck on chairs, trees, etc making it difficult to do simple things like, go to point A. Would really like the ability to use an on screen d-pad or external controller.

Timeless game and nice to have in my pocket when I have down time. But the new translation takes away some of the subtle charm of the original and the emulation is pretty bad with a lot of stuttering.

When this title originally launched, it showed as being compatible with my tablet (TF700).  I immediately bought it, as I never got to finish this game on my cousin's SNES when I was a kid.  When I got home I fired it up, only to find that just like others on here the game couldn't be loaded due to the screen resolution glitch.  Now it appears that they have changed the compatibility list, rather than working to update the game.  Given that this is Squeenix, I don't have any hope that they'll fix their mistake.  It also appears that this game requires a constant, or at least regular internet connection...for a 20-year-old game that can fit entirely in RAM.  Extremely bummed.  I won't miss that $10, but I also won't be buying any more Squeenix games for mobile devices.
Fun game.   But, take one phone call in the middle of playing the game and all progress since last save is lost! No fun!

Its not real hard to grasp the concept of updates. You think a multi billion dollar company can test their apps or games on EVERY single phone? Deal with the fact that this is by far, one of the best games ever made. Deal with the fact that you may have a junky phone. I didn't read reviews before i bought this, i just bought it. There was no hesitation. Updates will come.. Deal with it. Oh.. Get a clue how to save from the mini-map screen. You can save at ANY time from there. Just please stop whining..

I don't mind the anywhere analog stick, though I would prefer the option of an on screen D pad, but the inability to download the entire game makes subway gameplay risky or impossible. Fix that and I'll change to 5 stars.

This port is about 90% there, but it is missing one of the most crucial bits for an Android application, automatically saving state when the application looses focus (aka, receive a phone call).  I take public transit to work every day, about 45 minutes on the subway.  Great time for gaming/reading/etc, but if the save points are too far away, I play the same part over and over and over again.  Not much fun.  Fortunately, there is a very simply solution.  Keep the in game saves as is, spaced so far apart means you have to be careful in fights.  Add a "exit save" and "open load" function that only saves state when the app is not open, but does not allow you to abuse the save.  Seems fairly easy, and it'd be the best of both worlds!  Also, minor niggle, the whole app should be downloaded at once, or at worst, perhaps a separate in game download for each age.  If I'm on the subway with no signal, and try to enter a new area, the game just exited, without allowing me to save.  Kind of bogus.  Not currently worth $10.  Fix these two *MAJOR* problems, and it's back up to at least 4, maybe 5 stars.  With these two issues remaining, this game isn't even 1 star.
Loads in quarter of screen and can't continue, also online only DRM for a single player game wtf square this isn't Diablo 3
Like others completely unplayable on a tablet. Completely unacceptable from a developer like square.

The game works as good as the DS version and the SNES version.  Not as glitzy as the PSX version, but one must understand that this is an emulation of a 17 year old game on a 20 year old system.  The controls are very effective and responsive.  The graphics look decent for how old the game is, and the fact I am stretching it over  the screen of the Nexus 7.  I am running 4.1.1.

Poor controls but you can get used to them. But it's not right we pay $10 for this game but can't download the whole thing at once. Why do you guys botch nearly every remake you port to Android. First FF1 requiring Internet, then the whole root access for Chaos Rings, now this?
Unable to play on any of my Tablets. Transformer Prime and Acer A100

i would love to actually try the game but the screen formatting wont' work on my Acer A100.  it says "Additional data must be downloaded to play this game.  proceed?"  yet the OK button is off the screen, yet it is only using 1/8th of the screen right now.    do not buy this game until they fix these easy bugs.

First review ever couldn't stay quiet about this. Bought this my Galaxy S3 and it works ok on that. However on my Xoom it is unplayable, same as others, quarter of the screen used and can't download the rest of the game. This is the best game of all time Square should be ashamed of themselves for putting this out like this, and for 10 bucks no less.

I was a bit skeptical but Chrono Trigger works really well on my Sprint Nexus S 4G. Unfortunately there is no install to USB, but it's not too big of an install (although more downloads are required as you progress through the game).
Works, runs and looks great on the Samsung Galaxy S3! The touch controls work nicely on the newer devices and the graphics are just as good as the original!

The game is great, but it is not optimised for android multitasking. If I switch to another app then back to chrono, then all I see is a black screen. This, combined with the lack of quick save, is highly frustrating, as I cannot use my phone for anything during long periods between save points.

Extreme performance problems in my HTC desire. Strange, since it seems that it is a direct iOS port. It ran fine on an iPhone 4, but runs like crap in equivelent desire. For a game this old that runs without any kind of problem on an emulator, this reeks of an incompetent conversion.

I got a Sony Ericsson Xperia S and it looks and feel great with my screen, great port to android. However, there is one really big flaw since I bought this game so I could play to/from work and I go by train. I cannot download additional content while on the train...  We NEED an option to download the full game. What if I would buy it to play while on a long flight?

Works great on my Gnexus, but can't get past the initialization process on my Galaxy tab 10.1 due to the screen only covering 1/5 of the screen, and the buttons are gone. I hoped you would do a great job on this as you did with FF3, eagerly waiting for a patch :)
Internet required, brutal. I bought this while traveling hoping to play on trains, buses, but now I just rage. Also controls don't even make the game fun. I swear it, I'll never buy a SE game again.

The controls are quite good, I especially like how the virtual keypad appears where you tap, makes it easier since you don't have to know where the keypad is. Graphics are pretty much as good as one can hope from a 15+ year old game. However, the fact that not all game data is downloaded initially and that you sometimes, when switching an area, have to download additional data is poor and really ruins the experience.
This is a great port of a great game. I've had no issue of the border on my ASUS Nexus 7. The controls are also pretty easy to get used to.

For the most part, this game is good. Really good. Plot-wise, story-wise, this is on par with some of the best games ever created. However, the transition to touch-based controls leaves much to be expected; it feels awkward, too fickle, finicky... the re-translation is also a bit odd, but I'll get used to it. Font is odd, too.  Kinda wish the game had physical QWERTY keyboard controls, though, to replace the awkward touch-based controls. Surely it wouldn't be too hard to patch on?

The controls are ok but need some work, the game is a little choppy even with a high end phone and I wish it was full screen on my phone. I have played this game since it first came out close to 20 years ago and have loved it. It's by far my favorite square game ever and have played through every version of it but I have to say this 1 does have issues that really need to get fixed. Stop making bad ff games, you haven't made a good 1 since ff9,do something good for once, it's been a while
The $9.99 price tag is worth it to have the additional content and touchscreen controls,  especially with menus.  I'm happy so far with this,  runs great on S3.  The screen ratio is not a problem.
Yea boi....

These issues along with the changes to the menu system, the borders and the changes from the original dialogue all combine to mar what should have been the perfect tablet game. A singleplayer game that requires that you're connected to the internet to play it. I have a Nexus 7 and it's wifi only. I don't have a network connection everywhere I go, so that's an instant 1 star review from me until that's no longer the case.

Prompted that additional data needs to be downloaded but can't actually say OK because i can only see a quarter of the screen, then stuck. unacceptable for a paid app. ESPECIALLY for $10. transformer tf700
To anyone wondering where the save is, you have to scroll down to find it in the Menu.   So glad this is finally on the Android Market. Now can we PLEASE get Final Fantasy Tactics?

Tried to install the game on the Galaxy Tab. When I run the game I get a minimally sized screen saying that additional data must be downloaded, but I'm unable to select the options. Ended up uninstalling the software. Played with graphics settings and had no luck. Giving this one star until Square releases a fix.
Game seems to run a bit laggier compared to using an emulator, and it uses way more CPU than it should. Device gets hot. Otherwise great game.

Game runs great on my SGS3, however on my Xoom, I can't even get it to download the extra data as the game shows in the bottom left corner and the button to accept the extra data is off the bottom of the screen. If I wanted to play it on a smaller screen I'd play my DS version. I bought it to play on my 10 inch screen.
I wish there was an independant volume control so I could listen to my own music while playing. Also, the targeting system is difficult. Still, I love this game!
Better touch controllable than I expected.  This game never gets old. Classic.  Just waiting for FF4 and 6 to be ported.

Horrible controls mar a wonderful game. They are almost unusable and Square Enix should be ashamed. Fix the control and the equally horrible menu system and you'd have an instant classic reborn on your hands.

This was number 1 on my list of Square Enix games I wanted on Android!  I'm sure the tablet issues will be fixed just like the root issue on Chaos Rings.  Be patient!  It took them 6 days to fix that.
Game screen is crammed into the lower left portion of the screen making it unplayable on my Galaxy Tab 2!  Too late for refund now stuck with an unplayable $10 game...please fix on next update!

The game may be good but the interface is pretty bad.  You can press anywhere and a ball comes up and then you can slide to move in that direction.  It's pretty finniky and my finger keeps sliding way too much.  The FF1 was much better in my opinion with static arrows in the lower left and an action button.
One word, awesome!
Before, the app was absurdly laggy and bogged down. It wasn't an app so much as a mobile site. Now it's much better, but still not great. As many complain, it takes up too much space.

I loved the game on super Nintendo but found emulator app controls to be lacking. This official port seems to handle that nicely, allowing the ability to play with only one hand. The text has also been replaced for better readability, and the menus have been made mobile friendly. This is a great buy.

The menus are impossible to navigate. The character movement is ok but I couldn't figure out how to select anything. Some kind of tutorial is needed for controls. I couldn't even get to the mayors house to see if the original trainer had been updated. Please fix it!
Ah, Chrono Trigger. Good game, but I would really prefer to be able to play it.  I'll change my review once the issue is fixed.

Game runs great, controls aren't bad. Best game ever well worth $10!!!
My favorite game of all time!

The game only fills about a quarter of the screen which means I am unable to even accept the additional download when prompted. Unfortunately I waited to long to request a refund so now I'm stuck with a completely unplayable $10 game. This really needs to be fixed.

Completely invisible onscreen controls take up 0% of screen space unless you're actively moving around. 8-way movement joystick responds perfectly, and magically appears wherever you place your thumb and disapears as soon as you release - allowing lefties and righties to play with ease, and for people of all hand sizes to use it wherever it's most comfortable.  Great game, great port and features PLUS bonus content - 5 stars!

Runs fine on T-Mobile Galaxy S 2/Telux Galaxy S II X, sound/etc all seem to work well.  Aspect ratio of 4:3 appears to be preserved with small black bars on either side of the screen, i'd say 5-7% of each side of the screen are taken up.  To the people complaining about the borders just recall this game is based off sprites and is native 4:3 resolution, would have to redraw all elements of the game, or perform a stretch(which I am sure would incur even more wrath).    Keep em coming Square Enix.  WTB Final Fantasy Dimensions!

The presentation is pretty good and sharp, the controls are pretty good as far as touch screen controls go. There are black bars on the side most likely to preserve the 4:3 aspect ratio of the original.
You know what would be even better though, Secret of Mana.
Black bars around it and plays worse than an emulator. Square Enix are the laziest developers on Android.

I already have this game through my SNEs emulator but what better reason to complete it again. Simply one of the best RPGs I've ever played. Problem is it doesn't work on my prime. doesn't scale correctly. occupies about a quarter of the screen
